ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a broad overview of fundamental phenomena in classical optics. Might not be useful for advanced graduate students in applied physics but might be informative for those from engineering background (1st/2nd yr grad students).
This class is ideal for any physics or engineering graduate student or advanced undergraduate. I would certainly recommend it.
Very good introduction and review course. Anone who need some knowledge of optics should take it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It deals with microscopic techniques in different regimes and this was the most relevant part for my research. Helped me gain a theoretical understanding of optical techniques that are widely used in research.
The knowledge learned in this course was important for my dissertation and it has already provided a positive impact on my research.
Have great positive effect on my research work.
